intro: Malesherbia tocopillana, commonly known as the Tocopilla malesherbia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
